job_title: Regional Sales Director - Midwest - Remote | WFH
job_description:
Position: Regional Sales Director - Midwest

Company Overview: Our company is a leading provider of Educational Resources committed to delivering innovative learning solutions to educational institutions, parents, and caregivers of young children.

Role Overview

As the Regional Sales Director - Midwest, you will lead a dynamic team of Field Sales Account Managers across the designated geographic area of the United States. Your primary focus will be on executing sales strategies, nurturing client relationships, and achieving revenue targets. We are seeking a candidate who can effectively manage a remote team, providing guidance on key performance indicators (KPIs) and fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.

Regular engagement with both existing and prospective clients is essential to understand their evolving needs. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional presentation skills, adeptness in addressing customer needs across various levels, and a proven track record in sales management.

Key Responsibilities

Team Leadership:

Collaborate with team leadership to develop and optimize sales strategies.

Provide mentorship and guidance to a team of Account Managers to achieve collective goals.

Set objectives and facilitate professional development opportunities for team members.

Sales Strategy And Execution

Develop and implement regional sales strategies aligned with company objectives.

Identify key accounts, create sales plans, and monitor progress toward targets.

Analyze sales data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.

Client Relationship Management

Build and maintain strong relationships with key clients, ensuring exceptional sales and service delivery.

Support Account Managers in addressing client inquiries and resolving issues.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Collaborate with other departments to ensure alignment in strategies and execution.

Provide valuable insights from the field to contribute to product and service development.

Reporting And Forecasting

Prepare regular reports on regional sales performance and market trends for Senior Management.

Monitor and manage regional budgets to ensure adherence to financial objectives.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or related field.

Proven experience in Sales Management, preferably in the Educational Products/Services Industry.

Strong Leadership Abilities With Excellent Communication And Interpersonal Skills.

Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret sales data and derive actionable insights.

Willingness to travel within the assigned region as needed.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to lead and shape the success of our field sales efforts in the Early Childhood and Public Sector segments. We welcome candidates with a passion for leadership and a strategic mindset to join our team.

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, age, disability, or any other protected status under applicable laws.
